newsitem.title: FRANCE: French maize growers see 0.2 pct fall in 97 sowing.
newsitem.headline: French maize growers see 0.2 pct fall in 97 sowing.

text.p: A survey conducted at end March by the French maize growers association AGPM showed that sowings for the 1997 harvest might decline by 0.2 percent to 1.720 million hectares from 1.724 million in 1996.
AGPM released the survey, the first for the new crop, in its monthly report for April.
Sowings were expected to decline by some three to five percent in northern France but increase by two to four percent in traditional areas of the southwest, southeast and in the Alsace region.
The sharpest decline was forecast in the north of Paris region where sowings were seen falling by some 10 percent.
In centre-west regions (Poitou-Charentes) producers linked decisions to plant less maize to worries crops would not get enough moisture.
